item.title: November Forward Engineering 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This month, we have focused on revamping how we learn, familiarize, and work with tech. We are excited to announce that we have updated our Forward Engineering to better reflect the feedback and insights from our Labs team, Operations Team, and Consulting Team. This is to hopefully provide you with a more comprehensive publication that not only keeps you informed about the latest technologies and where they are applied, but also foster collaboration and innovation within our organization.

item.title: Implement a rust game through WASM
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Design a simple game concept suitable for implementation in Rust. Develop the game logic and user interface in Rust. Compile and optimize the Rust code for WASM. Test game performance and compatibility across various browsers.

item.title: Implementing a game server on Rust
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Develop a robust and efficient game server using Rust. Design the server architecture with a focus on scalability and performance. Implement core server functionalities like player management, real-time communication, and game logic. Test for concurrency and load handling.

item.title: Playaround With Rust
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Mozilla intends to use Rust as a platform for prototyping experimental browser architectures. Specifically, the hope is to develop a browser that is more amenable to safe and parallel than the existing ones, while also being less prone to common C++ coding errors.
